title: thrasher skate and destroy
content:
Maybe done by hand? Web search not so helpful. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026081646im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/skatend_4379.gif)

 [‹ Help finding this funky font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026081646/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44767 "Go to previous forum topic") [Pringles logo font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026081646/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44770 "Go to next forum topic")
author: the_loin

comments.content:
I’d guess that’s hand drawn, seeing as the S’s, A’s, E’s, D’s and T’s are different each time. Could be a complex OpenType font with lots of alternate characters, but I wouldn’t bet on it.

JH

thanks for confirming my own suspicions.

-=j=-
Yeah it’s just a logo, hand done originally by artist Craig Stecyk, who was involved in the early years of Dogtown, the birth of skateboarding and Southern California counterculture.
